intro: Freycinetia concinna, commonly known as the red-veined hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. Freycinetia concinna is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
